means: Students Hot on Conserving Kilowatts 严格节约能源的学生组织

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均含"冲击，碰撞"之意。
means: shock ： 指强烈冲击在肉体上或思想感情上所产生的效果。
impact ： 正式用词，侧重指物体相撞的结果或接触点。
collision ： 指物体相撞，其结果不是受损就是严重受阻。
clash ： 通常指两个或多个物体，特别是金属物发出刺耳声音或破裂声的撞击。也可引申指意见、利益等的冲突。

word_mean: 晕厥：一种突然发生的意识障碍
休克：以血液循环系统不能维持生命器官的充分灌注为特征的严重血液动力性及代谢性障碍
可起因于血容量不足(低血容量性休克)，心功能不足(心原性休克)，或血管舒缩紧张度不足(神经原性休克，败血症性休克)。低血容量或心原性休克的临床表现包括低血压、换气过度、肢凉、湿冷、皮肤紫绀、脉弱及脉速、尿少、意识模糊、局促不安或焦虑。败血症性休克开始表现为寒战、发热、皮肤潮红、轻度低血压及心输出量增加。如治疗无效，则其临床症状发展为与低血容量或心原性休克类似

sentence.Network_en: The violence in her tone gave Alistair a shock.
sentence.Network_cn: 她语气之强烈令阿利斯泰尔深感震惊。

sentence.Network_en: It was quite a shock to see my face on that screen!
sentence.Network_cn: 从那个屏幕上看到我的脸，真让人惊愕不已。

sentence.Network_en: The shock waves yesterday were felt from Las Vegas to San Diego.
sentence.Network_cn: 昨天从拉斯维加斯到圣迭戈都感觉到了这几股冲击波。

音箱最新产品音箱品牌大全 ... Enkor（ 恩科） Shock wave（ 冲击波） Soaiy（ 索爱）.

jx.jx_en_mean: (Brit.)a brief but harsh custodial sentence handed down to an offender in an attempt to discourage them from committing further offences
jx.jx_cn_mean: (英)从速从严打击（对罪犯采取的简捷、严厉的监管惩罚，以使其不再犯罪）

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 16th cent.: from French choc (noun), choquer (verb), of unknown origin. The original senses were 'throw (troops) into confusion by charging at them' and 'an encounter between charging forces', giving rise to the notion of 'sudden violent blow or impact'
Middle English: perhaps from Middle Dutch, Middle Low German schok, of unknown origin

mid 17th cent.: origin uncertain; compare with obsolete shough, denoting a breed of lapdog. The word originally denoted a dog with long shaggy hair, and was then used as an adjective meaning 'unkempt, shaggy'. The current sense dates from the early 19th cent

encyclopedia.content: 字面意思 1.Shock，中文意思是“休克” 急性循环功能不全的综合征。系由于有效血容量减少 ，心排出量不足或周围血液分布异常，致使组织灌注不良，细胞功能障碍，代谢异常，最后可造成生命重要脏器的功能丧失和机体死亡。分类 休克可按病理生理、临床特点、病因等分类，以病因分类法较为常用：①低血容量性休克。系因大量失血 、失水或失血浆所致。②心源性休克。见于急性大面积心肌梗死、严重心肌炎或心肌病、严重的心律失常等。

entry.tran: 震惊;惊愕;令人震惊的事
entry.def: If you have a shock, something suddenly happens which is unpleasant, upsetting, or very surprising.

example.ex: The extent of the violence came as a shock...
He has never recovered from the shock of your brother's death...
example.tran: 他从未从你哥哥去世的打击中恢复过来。

entry.def: Shock is a person's emotional and physical condition when something very frightening or upsetting has happened to them.

example.ex: The little boy was speechless with shock...
example.tran: 那小男孩惊得说不出话来。

example.ex: She's still in a state of shock.

entry.def: If someone is in shock, they are suffering from a serious physical condition in which their blood is not flowing round their body properly, for example because they have had a bad injury.

example.ex: He was found beaten and in shock...
They escaped the blaze but were rushed to hospital suffering from shock.
example.tran: 他们逃离了火海,却因休克而被迅速送往医院。

entry.def: If something shocks you, it makes you feel very upset, because it involves death or suffering and because you had not expected it.

example.ex: After forty years in the police force nothing much shocks me...
example.tran: 在警队呆了 40 年后，我对什么都见怪不怪了。

example.ex: Relief workers were shocked by what they saw.
example.tran: 救援人员被眼前的景象惊呆了。

entry.tran: (因行为粗鲁或不道德而)使不快，使气愤，使厌恶，使反感
entry.def: If someone or something shocks you, it upsets or offends you because you think it is rude or morally wrong.

example.ex: They were easily shocked in those days...
example.tran: 在那个年代，他们动不动就对一些事情看不顺眼。

entry.tran: (通告、事件等)令人惊愕的，令人震惊的
entry.def: A shock announcement or event is one which shocks people because it is unexpected.

example.ex: ...the shock announcement that she is to resign.
example.tran: 她将要辞职的惊人声明

entry.tran: (对经济、传统、生活方式的)冲击，撞击
entry.def: A shock is something sudden and unexpected that threatens the economy, traditions, or way of life of a group of people.

example.ex: This is the latest in a series of shocks to the Scandinavian banking system.
example.tran: 这是一系列对斯堪的纳维亚银行系统的冲击中最近的一次。

example.ex: ...the economic pain of two oil shocks.
example.tran: 两次原油冲击下的经济萧条

entry.def: A shock is the force of something suddenly hitting or pulling something else.

example.ex: Steel barriers can bend and absorb the shock.
example.tran: 钢制栅栏可以弯曲并能吸收冲击力。

entry.def: A shock is the same as an electric shock .
A shock is a shock absorber .

example.ex: Do you think I need new shocks?
example.tran: 你认为我需要换新的减震器吗？

entry.def: A shock of hair is a very thick mass of hair on a person's head.

example.ex: ...a very old priest with a shock of white hair.
example.tran: 满头白发、年事已高的神父

entry.def: A short, sharp shock is a punishment that is fairly harsh and severe but only lasts for a short time.

means.word_mean: 1. the feeling of distress and disbelief that you have when something bad happens accidentally;

sentences.sentence: "his mother's deathleft him in a daze"

means.word_mean: 2. the violent interaction of individuals or groups entering into combat;

sentences.sentence: "the armies met in the shock of battle"

means.word_mean: 3. a reflex response to the passage of electric current through the body;

sentences.sentence: "subjects received a small electric shock when they mae the wrong response"

means.word_mean: 4. (pathology) bodily collapse or near collapse caused by inadequate oxygen delivery to the cells; characterized by reduced cardiac output and rapid heartbeat and circulatory insufficiency and pallor;

sentences.sentence: "loss of blood is an important cause of shock"

means.word_mean: 5. an instance of agitation of the earth's crust;

sentences.sentence: "the first shock of the earthquake came shortly after noon while workers were at lunch"
"it came as a shock to learn that he was injured"

means.word_mean: 7. a pile of sheaves of grain set on end in a field to dry; stalks of Indian corn set up in a field;

sentences.sentence: "corn is bound in small sheeves and several sheeves are set up together in shocks"
"he had an unruly shock of black hair"

means.word_mean: 9. a mechanical damper; absorbs energy of sudden impulses;

sentences.sentence: "the old car needed a new set of shocks"

means.word_mean: 1. surprise greatly; knock someone's socks off;

sentences.sentence: "I was floored when I heard that I was promoted"
"The scandalous behavior of this married woman shocked her friends"
"The news of the bombing shocked her"

auth_sentence.content: We are trying to eliminate that sort of shock.
auth_sentence.res_content: We are trying to eliminate that sort of shock.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: We are trying to eliminate that sort of shock.

auth_sentence.content: I am sure the actual figure would shock everyone.
auth_sentence.res_content: I am sure the actual figure would shock everyone.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: I am sure the actual figure would shock everyone.

auth_sentence.content: My Bingo Bearcats are going to shock the world.
auth_sentence.res_content: My Bingo Bearcats are going to shock the world.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: My Bingo Bearcats are going to shock the world.

Sentence.sentence: If you think so, you're not alone, because energy independence has been the dream of American president for decades, and never more so than in the past few years, when the most recent oil price shock has been partly responsible for kicking off the great recession.
It turns out that the guy operates the printing machine with amazing speed, and soon he's turning out newspapers with shocking headlines.

A recent article in The Harvard Crimson noted the shocking growth of Harvard's public relations arm in the last five years and it questioned whether a focus on risk management and avoiding controversy was really the best outward-looking face of this great institution.
She went into shock after an operation.
I was shocked to hear of your wife's illness.

means.word_mean: 震动, （由爆炸、地震等引起的）剧烈震动, 剧烈震荡

sentences.en: The shock of the explosion was felt far away.
sentences.cn: 爆炸引起的震动很远都可感觉到。

sentences.en: You get an electric shock if you touch a live wire.
sentences.cn: 如果触动电线你会触电的。

sentences.en: His death was a great shock to the family.
sentences.cn: 他的死对他的家庭是一个很大的打击。

sentences.en: The news gave me a very great shock.
She died of shock following an operation on the brain.
sentences.cn: 她死于脑手术之后的休克。

sentences.en: The violence and bad language in the program shocked many of the viewers.
sentences.cn: 电视节目中的暴力场面和污秽语言使许多观众震惊。

sentences.en: They were shocked to hear of the bad news.
sentences.cn: 听说这则坏消息他们很震惊。

sentences.en: She got shocked when she touched the bare wire.
sentences.cn: 她摸了裸线, 遭电击了。

means.word_mean: 使…感到厌恶[恐惧]; 使气愤

sentences.en: He was shocked at her smoking.
sentences.cn: 他对她抽烟感到很厌恶。

jushi.english: The ship got a rude shock.
Several of those who survived the accident have been taken to hospital in a state of shock.
jushi.chinese: 有好几个在事故中幸存下来的人送到医院时处于休克状态。

jushi.english: That nasty shock cured him of his inquisitiveness for ever.
jushi.chinese: 那件令人讨厌的事把他爱管闲事的毛病彻底治好了。
